intro: Pentaraphia calycosa, commonly known as the calycose pentaraphia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Pentaraphia calycosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
